A brilliant cyan display fills the sky, lingers for a moment, then begins to fade.
Flashes of cyan light slowly diminish, retreating into tiny twinkling lights.
The bursting points of cyan light gradually fizzle out, leaving a gentle sparkle.
As cyan particles disperse, they create a fading halo effect in the dark sky.
Twinkling remnants of the firework’s explosion dissolve into darkness, disappearing.
The sky returns to its original state of black, as the firework show completes its cycle.
